text: De Lawd's Blues is an album by saxophonist Billy Mitchell recorded in 1980 for Xanadu Records.Ziegler, F. and Fitzgerald, M. Xanadu Records Listing, accessed April 24, 2017Jazzlists: Xanadu Records discography accessed April 24, 2017 ==Reception== The Allmusic review by Scott Yanow stated "Despite the mostly obscure material, the interpretations are purely straight-ahead, falling between bop and hard bop in style. The musicians all play up to par on Mitchell's third and final Xanadu album as a leader". ==Track listing== # "B & B" (Billy Mitchell) – 10:48 # "Not Just to Be in Love Again" (Dolo Coker) – 6:11 # "Prompt" (Benny Bailey) – 7:59 # "De Lawd's Blues" (Mitchell) – 11:06 # "Perpetual Stroll" (Rufus Reid) – 12:35 == Personnel == *Billy Mitchell – tenor saxophone *Benny Bailey – trumpet *Tommy Flanagan – piano *Rufus Reid – bass *Jimmy Cobb – drums == References== Category:1980 albums Category:Xanadu Records albums Category:Billy Mitchell (jazz musician) albums Category:Albums produced by Don Schlitten
title: De Lawd's Blues
